hero.title: We stopped the water. For good.
hero.subtitle: GD Supply is Georgia's professional waterproofing company. From foundation to roof.

services.title: What we do
services.subtitle: We deliver the full spectrum — from first consultation to final handover

items.title: Flat roof
items.body: The flat roof is the most vulnerable part of any building. We use multi-layer waterproofing systems — bituminous membrane, TPO, PVC and liquid coatings — providing 15–20 years of protection.
includes: Installing torch-applied membrane or liquid system
items.summary: Bituminous, TPO and PVC systems — 15–20 years of protection.

items.title: Terrace and balcony
items.body: A terrace is living space exposed to weather. We install waterproofing systems that tolerate seasonal temperature swings, repairs, and tile, stone or wood finishes.
includes: Special treatment of cracks and joints
items.summary: Elastic systems under tile or decking, tolerant to temperature swings.

items.title: Foundation and basement
items.body: Ground moisture and groundwater are the biggest threat to foundations. We waterproof both new builds and existing basements with specialized negative- and positive-side systems.

items.title: Industrial flooring
items.body: Workshops, malls, hospitals, parking decks — each needs a different approach. We install epoxy and polyurethane coatings that resist mechanical loads, chemicals, and moisture.
items.summary: Epoxy and polyurethane coatings for heavy loads.

items.title: Materials and import
items.body: We are official representatives of European brands in Georgia. We import premium construction chemicals, waterproofing materials, acoustic insulation, and specialized industrial coatings.

process.title: Process — stages
process.subtitle: GD Supply delivers the full waterproofing cycle — from the first visit through a 3-year service guarantee

steps.title: Consultation and inspection
steps.body: Our specialist visits the site, assesses the scope, and prepares a detailed budget — free of charge.

steps.title: System selection
steps.body: We choose the most suitable waterproofing system and materials based on the specifics of the site.

steps.title: Contract
steps.body: Timeline, price, and warranty terms — all written in the contract.

steps.title: Execution
steps.body: An experienced crew performs the work in full compliance with standards.

steps.title: Handover and warranty
steps.body: We hand over after full inspection. Warranty — 10+ years.

items.quote: GD Supply fully met our expectations. The flat roof we had issues with for years is now perfect. Work was delivered on time, cleanly, with no extra costs.
items.author: David K.

items.quote: For our hotel we needed a company experienced with commercial sites. GD Supply's team handled 2,400 m² of roof in 3 weeks — professionally and with high quality.
items.author: Nino B.

items.quote: Our school's yard and halls now have fully renewed floors. The epoxy coating is exactly what we needed. Safe for children and easy to clean.
items.author: Irakli M.

items.quote: The company completed work that other contractors refused — terrace waterproofing in a mountain region. The result is excellent.
items.author: Giorgi Ts.

items.a: Depending on the system — from 10 to 25 years. Bituminous membrane serves 10–15 years, TPO/PVC systems — 20–25 years. We provide a 10+ year workmanship warranty.
It depends on area and complexity. 100–300 m²: 3–5 working days. 500–1000 m²: 1–2 weeks. Commercial sites — individually.
Yes. We use systems adapted for all seasons. Some work types need temperatures above +5°C — in that case we select another material.
Yes, across Georgia. Logistics are discussed based on the location.

items.q: What is the difference between bitumen and TPO?
items.a: Bituminous membrane offers a good price/quality ratio and is a classic solution. TPO is longer-lasting, eco-friendly, and UV-resistant. Our specialist will choose the optimal system for your site.

items.q: Is a permit required for the work?
items.a: Normally waterproofing does not require permits. In some cases (heritage site, new build) it may be needed — we will advise.

items.q: What does inspection and estimation cost?
items.a: Site inspection and preliminary budgeting are completely free.
